Articles.Content:
Company Name: VEMLO Corp.

Engineer

Good at making probes and launch vehicles

Hey guys! Idea!

How about we make a database of launch vehicles engineered by the engineers! I'll make said rockets into official launch vehicles of the ISSO. And we can do the same for probes/landers.

Whaddya think?

And if anyone wants an assignment, send me a personal message or email me at [email protected]

ISSO Update

1-12-14 GMT 00:54

Two things:

If anyone wants an assigment, give me a PM and I'll give you one. We really need some to volunteer so this things starts working again.

Also, I have migrated the database to Google drive. All of our data is now in it.

ISSO Update

1-23-14 00:25 GMT

Two things:

1.Again, we need flight volunteers to get gears turning and other members inspired.

2. I'm thinking we should have engineers make/submit some stock rockets for pilots to use. I could throw them into a database on Google drive.

Hello ISSO members,

I would like to invite you all to become volunteer developers in my space science education project. I have a thread here in fan works "Visions of 2070" with all the informaton you need to get started:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67002-Visions-of-2070?p=924612#post924612

Cheers,

Chris

ISSO Update

1-23-14 00:25 GMT

Two things:

1.Again, we need flight volunteers to get gears turning and other members inspired.

2. I'm thinking we should have engineers make/submit some stock rockets for pilots to use. I could throw them into a database on Google drive.

Glad that this is back on its feet! Anyways, Ive got stock rockets every where! Anyways, because of my laziness, Im wondering; are we passing a save around? If so, I could happily apply to do orbital rendezvous, docking, etc. and all the simple extremely complex everyday orbital maneuvering, for the peoples here. Also, database needs a link on the OP for peoples's viewing pleasure.
Landed a probe on Minmus and got some data.
Now get out there and do some science!

Just some mission that I had lying around

Mission name: Boredom

Unmanned

Craft Name: MicroRover Mk1

Mission Objective: Explore KSC

Mission Outcome: Success!

Mission Status: Complete

Mission Pictures:

The rover on the runway

A close up

Wondering around... Exploring

The Mk1 pod monument

Deal with it.
